content: We are pleased to report first quarter revenue of $85.9 million, an increase of 31.1% compared to the same period last year. Net income for the quarter on a GAAP basis was $31 million and $34.1 million on the non-GAAP basis, reflecting year-over-year growth of 16%. As a result of our strategy of focusing on selling more system on the global market, sales of capital equipment was strong, representing 84% of our total revenue in the first quarter. Looking at the international side of the business, first quarter sales outside the U.S. accounted for $32.3 million or 38% of total sales, a 50.6% increase compared to the same quarter last year. The U.S. remains the leading market for InMode and was the biggest contributor to our top line, with total first quarter sales amounting to $53.6 million compared to $44.1 million in the same quarter of 2021. GAAP operating expenses in the first quarter were $36.1 million, a 26% increase year-over-year. On a non-GAAP basis, operating expenses totaled approximately $33.4 million in Q1 of 2022 compared to operating expenses of $26.2 million in the same quarter of 2021, an increase of 27%. On the cash flow front, the company generated $31.9 million from operating activities in the first quarter of 2022. Before I turn the call back to Moshe, I would like to reiterate our guidance for 2022, revenues between $415 million and $425 million, non-GAAP gross margin between 84% and 86%, non-GAAP income from operations between $199 million to $204 million, non-GAAP earnings per diluted share between $2.06 and $2.11.
